definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
"Collection of the Most Important Military Techniques", book published in 1044 during the Northern Song Dynasty

sentences.english: So then, let us not be like others, who are asleep, but let us be alert and self-controlled.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们不要睡觉，像别人一样，总要儆醒谨守。

sentences.english: Others are chock full of loans, which must be re-paid.
sentences.chinese: 而有些呢，全部是贷款，总要还的。

sentences.english: The new thing's appearance must have the running-in period.
sentences.chinese: 新事物的出现总要有磨合期。

sentences.english: Before each meal my father or mother would say a prayer of thanks.
sentences.chinese: 吃饭前父亲或母亲总要作谢饭祷告。

sentences.english: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of a wife.
sentences.chinese: 有钱的只身总要娶位太太，这是全球公认的真理。

sentences.english: I'm sick of13 having something to do all the time and all I really want is to have some time of.
sentences.chinese: 我厌烦总要做这做那，我想要的就是有自己的时间。

sentences.english: Even now, he will play catch till his whole shoulder gives out.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他还玩传球游戏，而且总要玩到整个肩膀发酸。

sentences.english: Therefore let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be sober.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们不要睡觉，像别人一样，总要儆醒谨守。

sentences.english: The coach is always gloomy when the team loses a game.
sentences.chinese: 球队一输球，教练总要绷起脸来。

sentences.english: For what make people be again harmed dead by the childe after producing good will to the some role?
sentences.chinese: 为啥总要让人对某角色产生了好感后再被公子害死？

sentences.english: Patient:Well, I've got a terrible stomach-ache and I keep needing the toilet.
sentences.chinese: 我的肚子痛得非常厉害，而且我总要频繁去洗手间。

sentences.english: I tend to believe that people always make mistakes, learn so only gradually do the right thing.
sentences.chinese: 我倾向相信，人总要犯错，才渐渐学晓做对的事。

sentences.english: People always want to look at something, toward high and shore up the life and soul.
sentences.chinese: 人总要仰望点什么，向着高远，支撑起生命和灵魂。

sentences.english: I'll get upsides with him some day.
sentences.chinese: 有朝一日，我总要和他把账算得互不相欠。

sentences.english: But that which ye have already hold fast till I come.
sentences.chinese: 但你们已经有的，总要持守，直等到我来。

sentences.english: Watch ye and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.
sentences.chinese: 总要儆醒祷告，免得入了迷惑。

definition: hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
(followed by a verb phrase, then – optionally – 不可, or 不行 etc) must
in the end/after all is said and done
(reduplicated) whether... or.../never mind/fine (indicating acceptance or resignation)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
